refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: sbpctl install installs systemd-boot-password into the EFI system partition. systemd-boot-password will be installed as default EFI loader at /EFI/BOOT/BOOT*.EFI.
sbpctl standalone creates a standalone EFI application with initramfs and Linux EFI application included.
sbpctl generate prompts for password and generates a SHA-512 hash sum which you can add to the basic configuration file.

listitem.para: Include configuration file to EFI binary. In this case boot manager will never read configuration from file.
Boot manager will be installed only as default EFI loader at /EFI/BOOT/BOOT*.EFI.
Boot manager will be signed with keys located at /etc/sbp/db.key and /etc/sbp/db.crt using sbsign util.
Path to the EFI System Partition (ESP).
EFI application will be signed with keys located at /etc/sbp/db.key and /etc/sbp/db.crt using sbsign util.
Path to Linux initramfs.
Path to Linux EFI application.
Path to output EFI application.

refsect1.title: Configuration files
refsect1.para: The basic configuration file is located at /loader/loader.conf of your EFI system partition or at /etc/sbp/loader.conf if you planning include configuration to EFI binary. The basic confguration file supports the following options:

listitem.para: Default entry to select. This options can take a name of entity configuration file or entryINDEX if entry is included to basic configuration file.
Menu timeout. Can take a 0 value, in this case menu will be shown on Esc key press during boot process.
Defines whether enable the kernel parameters editor with e key. A 1 value enables editor, 0 disables. Editor is enabled by default.
A SHA-512 hash sum of password. User will be prompted for password to access kernel parameters editor.

refsect1.para: Boot entry configuration files are located at /loader/entries/*.conf of your EFI system partition or can be included to basic configuration file divided by empty line. The boot entry confguration file supports the following options:

listitem.para: Entry title to display.
Version displayed for non-unique entries.
Machine ID displayed for non-unique entries.
EFI program to start.
EFI program to start. This will also automatically add initrd option to kernel parameters.
Path to initramfs.
EFI image architecture. Allows to filter EFI images not matching your architecture.
Default kernel parameters. These options may be changed with enabled editor.

refsect1.title: Exit status
refsect1.para: On success, 0 is returned, a non-zero failure code otherwise.
